announcements.title: Atmospheric Water Generators Now on Campus
announcements.message:
As an initiative towards making NYUAD more sustainable, the Department of Environmental Health and Safety (EHS) is excited to announce that 20 Atmospheric Water Generators have been installed around campus and are ready for our use.

Apart from the environmental benefits such as sustainable water supply and zero waste water, the use of Atmospheric Water Generators is beneficial to personal health by producing pure, chemical, carcinogen, and bacteria-free water.

To operate, touch the water icon and the water will flow. The unit erroneously tells you to press the button, but the water activation is via a touch screen sensor. Simply touch the water icon again to stop the flow. Please note there may be a second or so delay in the water delivery.

announcements.title: Lunch & Learn: Intersectionality
announcements.message:
In her 2016 Ted Talk, Kimberle Crenshaw, Esq. revisits the concept of “intersectionality,” a term she coined in 1989 to describe the double discrimination which Black women faced, experiencing systemic, race- and gender-based oppression. Crenshaw challenges the audience to consider the importance of the “frames” through which we see-or more aptly, do not see- Black [American] women, the cyclical nature of their struggles, and how systemic social problems impact them as a subset of a targeted group. Students, staff, and faculty are invited to view with Crenshaw’s talk together; explore the concept of intersectionality through the lens of contemporary case studies; and consider ways to embody the concept, for our own awareness and, critically, for the humanity and safety of those with whom we are in community.

Join Alta Mauro, Phd, Director of SLICE in examining these case studies over a lunch on April 12 at 17-1:30 pm C2, E247.

Lunch will be served.

Sign Up.

announcements.title: Public Philosophy Talk: Transformative Experience
announcements.message:
On Thursday 12 April at 7:00pm (in A3 005), this year's Distinguished Philosopher-in-Residence, L. A. Paul (University of North Carolina at Chapel Hill and St. Andrews University), will be giving a public talk on "Transformative Experience." Please join us!

ABSTRACT: Going to war, having a baby, being spiritually reborn, betraying your lover, emigrating to a new country — all of these are experiences that can transform you. By transforming you, they change you, and in the process, they restructure the nature and meaning of your life. I’ll discuss the nature of transformative experience, and show how exploring its conceptual structure can help us to understand the special and distinctive ways that new experiences can form and change us, and how this relates to how we make life choices, both big and small.

Recherche de participants francophones pour une étude sur la neuroscience du langage

Des chercheurs à NYUAD mènent une étude sur l’activité cérébrale liée au langage et ont besoin de votre aide!

Si le français est votre langue maternelle, vous avez plus de 18 ans, vous êtes droitier et avez une vision normale (ou portez des lentilles de contact), vous êtes admissibles à cette étude.

L'étude aura lieu au laboratoire « Neuroscience of Language Lab », A2-008 sur le campus de Saadiyat, et prendrai une à deux heures de votre temps. L'étude débutera la semaine prochaine et se déroulera tout au long du semestre. Vous devrez être disponible pendant la semaine, pour une durée de 1-2 heures entre 9h et 19h.

Les participants recevront une somme de 30 AED par demi-heure comme allocation de transport et repas.

announcements.title: Sultan Bin Khalifa Int'l Thalassemia Award
announcements.message:
Thalassemia is one of the most common inherited blood disorders known.  In the absence of comprehensive prevention programs, and with over 490 million thalassemia carriers worldwide, this disease drains the medical, social and economic resources of many nations. The "Sultan Bin Khalifa International Thalassemia Award", a division of "HH Sheikh Sultan Bin Khalifa Al Nahyan Humanitarian & Scientific Foundation", recognizes the dedicated efforts and contributions made towards improving the quality of life of patients suffering from thalassemmia or other hemoglobinopathies.

NYUAD Faculty, Staff & Students are cordially invited to the upcoming awards ceremony scheduled for April 12, 2018, starting at 6:30 pm, at Emirates Palace.  For futher information, please visit their website: 

http://www.sbkf.ae/foundation/contents.php?ct_id=162

Interested in attending the ceremony? Kindly email Aisha Al Hamiz with your coordinates (name, position, mobile, and email address) by April 8, 2018.

announcements.title: Economics Seminar Series: Samuel Bowles
announcements.message:
5 April 2018  I  1:15-2:45 PM  I  A5 101 

Part of the Economics Seminar Series

Professor Samuel Bowles (Santa Fe Institute & CORE)  presents "The Moral Economy: Whygood incentives are no substitute for good citizens"

About

Samuel Bowles, (PhD, Economics, Harvard University) headsthe Behavioral Sciences Program at the Santa Fe Institute. Bowles' research includestheoretical and empirical studies of political hierarchy and wealth inequalityand their evolution over the very long run. Recent books are The Moral Economy: Why goodlaws are no substitute for good citizens (2016) and A CooperativeSpecies: Human reciprocity and its evolution (with Herbert Gintis, 2011), His next will be Equality’s Moment: The origins and future ofeconomic disparity and political hierarchy.  With CORE(Curriculum Open-access Resources for Economics), he has produced a newintroduction to economics (www.core-econ.org).

Join us for a reading on Saturday, April 7, from 10:00-11:00am (C3-006) featuring three short one-act plays written by NYUAD students and inspired by Shakespeare’s lost play Cardenio. And please join us for the final evening's performances, when all four student teams will be presenting their work with Pericles: Sunday, April 8, 7:30-9:00pm (C3-144)!

announcements.message:

announcements.title: Long Night’s Journey Into Day — Screening
announcements.message:
Long Night’s Journey Into Day 

Directed by Deborah Hoffman and France Reid

Wednesday April 4, 2018, 6:30PM C3-B101

A documentary of South Africa's quest for restorative justice following four cases that come before the Truth and Reconciliation Commission (TRC).

2000 Academy Award Nominee: Best documentary feature

2000 Sundance Festival Film Festival: Grand Prize Winner, Best Documentary

Screening followed by a discussion about the legal, nationalist, and performative aspects of TRCs in South Africa and elsewhere.

For more information, contact samuel.mark.anderson@nyu.edu

announcements.title: Visual Engagements. Image Practices and Falconry
announcements.message:
April 4 - 5, 2018 - A6, Room 010

This workshop will mainly address common intersections between culture and nature such as Seeing/Not Seeing, Perspective, Simulations, questions on Political Iconography, materials such as feathers as well as the Migration of Objects and Images.

Why do treatises in Early modern Period consider seeing as a form of hunting? How is this metaphor as well as flying itself manifested in images? What are the common points between image practices and the iconic power of Falconry?

In addition to these theoretical and present-day considerations, artists working on Falconry will have a dialogue with a professional Arab falconer and a Bedouin poet, adding a further central point to the workshop namely the connection between theory and practice.

For more information please contact Alexandra Sandu on alexandra.sandu@nyu.edu

announcements.title: Why is the campus blue?
announcements.message:
Why is the campus blue?

It’s April and the Office of Community Outreach is excited to join the global campaign Light it up Blue for the 4th year running. We’ve turned the exterior of the campus dome blue to mark the beginning of a meaningful month-long commitment. April is Autism Awareness Month worldwide but NYUAD wants to move beyond just awareness - to promote greater acceptance, support, and education throughout the UAE.

Stay tuned for more exciting updates throughout April! Be on the lookout for information about film screenings, volunteering opportunities and save the date for the annual Autism Education Conference happening on Saturday, April 14th.

announcements.title: Go Green Week | The Great Nurdle Hunt!
announcements.message:
NYUAD's Go Green Week 2018 is coming to NYUAD April 16-22 and the theme of the year is plastics. You can contribute to this citizen science project right here on Saadiyat Island by joining the Great Nurdle Hunt- a collaboration between the OCO, EHS and NYUAD Alumni Association and part of NYU’s Global Day of Service! 

Nurdles are small plastic pellets used in the manufacturing of plastic products that often end up in our oceans and wash up on beaches. Through this fun and educational event you will compete in teams of students, alumni and faculty/staff to collect nurdles from the Park Hyatt beach while learning about the effect of plastics on local ocean life. Sign up as an individual or a register as a team of up to four people. Breakfast will be provided.

Location: Park Hyatt Saadiyat (Transportation will be provided)

Date: Friday, April 20th

Time: 8:00AM- 10:00AM (The bus will depart the Welcome Center at 7:30AM).

To sign up for this event, please register here

announcements.title: InterCultural Learning Program- Spring 2018
announcements.message:
What is ICLP? And why YOU should Sign Up for It?

Intercultural Competence is a key capability for working and living effectively with people from different cultures. The InterCultural Learning Program (ICLP) facilitates becoming more self-aware, conscious of the ways that you have been socialized, and the impact of your socialization on you positionality, intersectionality, and ability to bridge gaps between yourself and your beliefs and those of others.

Watch this awesome video and learn about participant experiences with ICLP.

The Intercultural Learning Program (ICLP) focuses on:

  • Achieving diversity and inclusion goals within organizations.

  • Reducing bias and ethnocentrism among people.

  • Building productive and positive relations both within your own culture/country and internationally.

The upcoming ICLP cohort dates are April 1, 8 & 15, 1:15-4:15PM, C2 E247

Sign Up !

announcements.title: TALK: Women and Gender in the Qur'an
announcements.message:
This informative talk by Professor Asma Barlas will delve into the perspective of someone who doesn't make connections between tafsir and gender. Her talk will focus on explaining her understanding of the Qur’an’s stance on gender and will explore the theoretical and theological implications of secular-/feminist critiques of the Qur’an and on human creation, agency, and moral individuality. 

The latter half of the conversation will be open for questions so please come with questions!

(A6) room 006 on Monday April 9th from 7-8:30pm. 

Register your interest.

Dinner will be served.

announcements.title: JUST ANOTHER ACCENT (short film) premiere
announcements.message:
You are cordially invited to attend the "Just Another Accent " premiere

Synopsis: A young Emirati woman uses her speech impediment as the catalyst to help others in the United Arab Emirates.


The documentary aims to raise awareness of stuttering and wipe off the stigma that has long been attached to it. The film also follows Farah Al Qaissieh’s journey in supporting the stuttering community through her non-profit organization of Stutter UAE and the features other people who stutter and the issues they face in everyday life.

The film followed by Q&A with the female lead and reception after.  

April 5   |  7:00 PM (sharp) - 8:30 PM |  A6-008

RSVP here: https://goo.gl/HNovQm  [Open to Public]

For inquiries, kindly contact Sanaa Amro, Student Life, saa11@nyu.edu)

announcements.title: Student job - Do you speak Tagalog or UAE Arabic?
announcements.message:
You MUST be a native speaker of either Tagalog or Emirati Arabic to be eligible for this position. This is a student assistantship position.

The Neuroscience of Language Lab is looking for students to assist with research!

Primary responsibilities include:

-Design and construction of experimental stimuli

-Serving as a language consultant 

-Participant recruitment for experiments

 

Applicants should:

- Be able to work well both independently and in a group

- Possess strong communication, interpersonal, and time management skills

- Have attention to detail, be well-organized, and have strong ability to multi-task

 

Interest/experience/passion in Psychology, Neuroscience, or Linguistics is a plus!

Email Samantha Wray at scw9@nyu.edu for more information.

announcements.title: VOLUNTEER | Turtle Patrol on Saadiyat
announcements.message:
Join the Turtle Patrol to participate in the conservation of endangered Hawksbill turtles on Saadiyat island. Volunteers will commit to running or walking along a portion of the Park Hyatt beach at least once a week looking for turtle nests. You will be trained on what to do if you do come across a nest, as nests need to be recorded, protected, and occasionally relocated. The turtle patrol will be happening for the rest of Spring 2. The university will provide transport on Saturday mornings, but you are encouraged to sign up for any day you are available if you are able to arrange your own transport.

  • Location: Park Hyatt Saadiyat (Transportation will be provided on Saturday Mornings)
  • Date: Mornings, April-May
  • Time: 6-8:30am (Transport will leave the Welcome Center at 5:45am on Saturdays)

If you want to get involved in the conservation of this critically endangered species sign up here!

Questions? Contact Community Outreach.

announcements.title: Summer Course: US in Conflict
announcements.message:
NYU Abu Dhabi will offer a summer 2018 course in the United States for 15 NYUAD students chosen by competitive application. The application deadline for the course is April 1, 2018. Finalists will be announced by April 15, 2018. 

LEAD-UH 2110 The United States in Conflict: Cases from Politics, Economics, Media, Culture, and Law 

This US-based course provides students with an understanding of the interconnection between politics, economics, entrepreneurship, media, law, and culture in the United States and with critical tools to interact with and explain the US to others. Students are challenged to think deeply about these fields and their continual impact on entrepreneurship and soft power worldwide. Interaction with and instruction by influential persons in locations across the United Ststes will provide students with an unprecedented opportunity to interact with key people in these fields, developing perspectives on entrepreneurship and its role in US society.

announcements.title: A message of thanks from Operation Smile to NYUAD
announcements.message:
"Operation Smile would like to thank you and all the generous donors who during the months of January & February 2018, have helped raise AED 620 through textile donations made in the Operation Smile UAE textile recycling bank housed on your premises. 

We are delighted that for this period, the funds raised through donations received from all participants of the Operation Smile UAE textile recycling initiative throughout the UAE is sufficient to fund more than 45 surgeries, giving those children the new ‘SMILES’ they so desperately deserve.

Operation Smile UAE will be holding our very popular second-hand book sale at Al Wahda Mall from March 29-31 in the main atrium. We do hope you will spread the word to your community and that they will support our cause by visiting our stand and purchasing a book or two! All the funds raised will go towards providing those in need with free, reconstructive facial surgeries."

Support this cause and volunteer at the book sale on March 31!

announcements.title: CDC GMAT Registration Waivers Available from CDC
announcements.message:
This year only the GMAC has granted the CDC 10 registration waivers for the Graduate Management Admission Test (GMAT). The GMAT is an exam typically required for application to graduate programs worldwide in business, finance, economics and more. To learn more visit GMAC.com. 

Eligibility requirements, as defined by GMAC, include: 
1) taking the exam before October 5, 2018,
2) demonstrating financial need as determined through CDC consultation with the NYUAD Office of Financial Support.

Apply for this waiver by:
1) submitting a completed CDC GMAT Waiver Request form no later than 9AM GST on Sunday, April 8, 2018.

Selection is based on:
1) financial need, as well as
2) timeliness of application. If eligible applicants exceed amount of waivers, priority will be given to early applicants. If waivers exceed the amount of eligible applicants, the application will reopen fall 2018.

Announcements will be made April 15, 2018. If you have any questions, please email nyuad.career@nyu.edu.

announcements.message:
Intercultural Competence is a key capability for working and living effectively with people from different cultures. 

The Intercultural Learning Program (ICLP) focuses on:

  • achieving diversity and inclusion goals within organizations, 
  • reducing bias and ethnocentrism among people, and
  • building productive and positive relations both within your own culture/country and internationally.

1:15-4:15 pm

April 1, 8 & 15

announcements.title: 2018 Employee Payroll Tax Withholding
announcements.message:
~~Dear NYU Employees,
We are writing you as a follow up to our previous communication regarding the Tax Cuts and Jobs Act.
The IRS updated the 2018 income tax withholding tables and issued related guidance on January 11th. The new tax withholding tables have been designed to work with the current Form W-4 (Employee's Withholding Allowance Certificate). The changes in employees' payroll tax withholdings were reflected in paychecks beginning January 31. Please consult your tax advisor with questions about your personal tax situation and how the new federal tax rates impact your with-holding and annual tax obligations. You may also refer to the information published by the IRS at:https://www.irs.gov/pub/irs-pdf/n1036.pdf.
The IRS has issued guidance that the Form W-4 will be redesigned for tax year 2019 to reflect the suspension of the personal exemption deduction.  We will alert you when the new Form W-4 is available so you can update your information for 2019.

announcements.title: Jedi Training
announcements.message:
The Jedit Training is a two part series delving into spiritual practice and discipline from a holistic, experiential approach

Part 1-  We will discuss the spiritual themes and theory behind the JEDI knights and look at how some of the wisdom and concepts in the Star Wars movies have connections to traditional spiritual practices across cultures. We will also learn JEDI mind tricks and the power of positive thinking.

Part 2- This will be a physical, experiential workshop focused on putting some of the concepts into practice. Participants should wear athletic attire and come prepared to move their body as we learn about spacial awareness, physical agility and breaking through the limitations of the body.

 

You can know more about other participants' experience with Jedi Training through this video.

On Saturday, March 31st  Operation Smile will host its Big Book Sale at Al Wahda Mall. They are looking for a handful of volunteers to help out. Responsibilities will include dealing with customers, organizing books according to genre and author, and maintaining a safe working environment. It will be a fun event and a great way to raise awareness of the charity.

Location: Al Wahda Mall

Date: Saturday, March 31st

Time: 2- 6pm (The bus will depart the Welcome Center at 1:30pm).

To volunteer for this event, please register here.

If you have any questions, please email tala.hammash@nyu.edu

announcements.title: 2018 Summer Internship Funding Program
announcements.message:
The deadlines for the 2018 Summer Internship Grant are hard deadlines and late or incomplete applications will not be reviewed. Meeting all of the requirements before the application deadlines, allows your application to be reviewed and considered for funding. 

The summer internship grant is a competitive program and funding is not guaranteed. This grant is a supplemental award, so regardless of the success of your application, please make sure that you are always pursuing alternative forms of funding. 

You are highly encouraged to read through the guidelines which can be accessed here.

announcements.title: Native English speakers needed for research study
announcements.message:
NYUAD faculty are conducting a study designed to investigate brain responses to sentence structure and meaning and need your help!

If you are over 18 years old, a NATIVE English speaker, are right-handed and have normal or corrected to normal vision without glasses (lenses are fine), you are eligible to participate in this study.

The study will take place at the Neuroscience of Language Lab, A2-008 on the Saadiyat campus, and will require one to two hours of your time. You should be available during the week, for a 2-hour block of time between 9am – 7pm.

Participants will receive a transportation and meal allowance of 30 AED per half hour.

To express interest in participating, or for more information, please contact our research staff at meglab-nyuad-group@nyu.edu.

announcements.title: Congratulations Chris Wheeler!
announcements.message:
Please join us in congratulating Chris Wheeler who took home the prize of Best Variety Act at this year's Ultra Violet Live Talent competition in New York this past Thursday!

ULTRAVIOLET LIVE [UVL] is a New York University tradition showcasing the best of NYU student talent. Preliminary rounds are hosted across the global campus and the best 15 acts compete live on the Skirball stage. UVL, sponsored by the Inter-Residence Hall Council [IRHC], is now in its fourteenth year at NYU New York and 6th year at NYU Abu Dhabi.

Talent ranges from singer/songwriters, dancers, magicians, bands, rappers, comics, speed painters, contortionists and more! NYU alumni and special guests serve as host and judges for the event. Winners are selected by the judges in Best Solo Act, Best Group Act, Best Variety Act and the UVL Grand Prize Winner.

announcements.title: Oceans Research Internship Program- African Campus
announcements.message:
The Oceans Research Internship Program enables aspiring scientists and conservationists to work in conjunction with leading marine biologists as they undertake ground-breaking research on the charismatic marine mega-fauna of Southern Africa, including great white sharks.

This is a unique internship experience where students gain exposure to a wide variety of projects and in depth aspects of practical field research on species such white sharks, bottlenose dolphins, Southern right whales and smaller benthic shark species. Research will be done both at sea and on land. During your stay you play a vital role, from data collection to data management. We use your collected data to advise various industries, including the government, on real-time issues in marine conservation. 

For further information, please visit the African Campus website.

announcements.title: 2018 Founders' Day Awards
announcements.message:
As a Commencement honor, top-ranking baccalaureate candidates and graduates of all NYU schools are named University Honors Scholars, earning them the NYU Founders’ Day Award. Recipients receive a gold tassel that they can wear during Commencement, as well as a personalized certificate.

After almost a year of deliberation, the NYU University Senate, which includes representation from all NYU schools - inluding NYU Abu Dhabi, has decided to modify the selection criteria for the Founder's Day award. Instead of the previous policy of designating all students who had a 3.5 cumulative GPA or higher, the University will award all students who graduate in the top 40% of their respective schools. This cross-school consistency is an important part of being an NYU global institution. For NYU Abu Dhabi - as for other NYU schools - this will mean that somewhat fewer students will receive this accolade. At the same time, the prestige for those who do is enhanced.

announcements.title: ICLP
announcements.message:
InterCultural Learning Program (ICLP)

Sundays, Apr. 1, 8 & 15 | C2 E247

You can now register to save your seat for Spring 2018 ICLP cohort 2. As a result of participating in ICLP, you will begin to:

1. Differentiate between individual and cultural differences;

2. Recognize that we operate within cultural contexts and the complexity of systems & one’s position within them;

3. Acknowledge and consider multiple cultural perspectives;

4. Demonstrate increasingly complex understanding of cultural orientations;

5. Identify our own cultural rules and biases;

6. Use frameworks and concepts introduced to analyze social situations;

7. Formulate increasingly nuanced cultural questions; and

8. Strengthen our capacity to tolerate ambiguity.

 

Sign up!

announcements.title: VOLUNTEER | Imagine Science Abu Dhabi 2018
announcements.message:
Imagine Science Films is looking for volunteers for Imagine Science Abu Dhabi 2018 beginning February 22 2018! The festival dates are March 8-10, 2018. More info at imaginesciencefilms.org/ad4

In its fourth year, Imagine Science Abu Dhabi explores the latest in the global intersection between art and science. Featuring groundbreaking documentaries, thought-provoking scientific fictions, and dazzling experimental films from the UAE, the Gulf, and beyond, this hybrid festival seeks to break down interdisciplinary boundaries through science films that defy the norm.

Volunteers will help as exhibition installers, virtual reality assistants, docents, crowd control, promotion and other general festival assistance.

Please contact lkaye@imaginesciencefilms.org if interested!

announcements.title: Native English speakers needed for research study
announcements.message:
NYUAD faculty are conducting a study designed to investigate brain responses to sentence structure and meaning and need your help!

If you are over 18 years old, a native English speaker, are right-handed and have normal or corrected to normal vision without glasses (lenses are fine), you are eligible to participate in this study.

The study will take place at the Neuroscience of Language Lab, A2-008 on the Saadiyat campus, and will require one to two hours of your time. You should be available during the week, for a 2-hour block of time between 9am – 7pm.

Participants will receive a transportation and meal allowance of 30 AED per half hour.

To express interest in participating, or for more information, please contact our research staff at meglab-nyuad-group@nyu.edu.

announcements.title: Global Shakespeare Student Festival!
announcements.message:
Dates: April 6-8, 2018

Events: The Global Shakespeare Student Festival brings student teams from other universities to NYUAD for three days to collaborate and explore Shakespeare’s plays. Join the NYUAD student team to participate in the Festival, which includes faculty masterclasses and troupe-led workshops, student performances, and a chance to connect with other students. This year our shared text is Shakespeare’s play Pericles, which we want to use as a lens to think about Global Shakespeare.

To Participate:

--NYUAD student team members must commit to participating in the Festival all day Friday and Saturday, with a performance on Sunday night (but you won’t miss Sunday classes)

--NYUAD student team members will read Pericles, and then prepare a short performance and lead a student workshop during the Festival

--To sign up, or with any questions: email Prof. Katherine Williams (katherine.williams@nyu.edu) or Fidan Gasim (fidan.gasim@nyu.edu)

announcements.title: Join the Writing Partners Program!
announcements.message:
The NYUAD Writing Program and Writing Center are thrilled to offer the Writing Partners Program again this spring!

The Writing Partners Program (WPP) is a series of personalized meetings between you and a Writing Instructor in the Writing Center. The program is fully student driven and student centered -- you get to decide what you want to work on over the course of the semester -- papers, essays, presentations, reading skills, creative projects, etc.  The possibilities are endless.  Your Writing Instructor is there to guide you throughout the semester and serve as a dedicated reading and writing partner.

If you are part of the WPP you will meet at least 6 times with your Writing Instructor over the course of this semester. Your Writing Instructor and you determine when these meetings take place and you determine what you want to work on. 

Interested? Fill out this form!

Questions? Email: nyuad.writing@nyu.edu

announcements.message:
Volunteer at the Future Rehabilitation Centre and work with teachers, staff & students with intellectual disabilities! Support students aged 3-23 in art, music, athletics, reading, among others. The Centre wants volunteers to be "ready for action" & prepared to help FC students "learn through fun."

Classes run from 9-1pm, Sun-Thurs. Volunteers must make a minimum classroom commitment of at least one hour, once a week.

All volunteering needs to account for 40 min. travel time to and from the center (a great time to catch up on readings and podcasts!). You must have a minimum 2.5 hours availability in your schedule to volunteer.

Volunteers are required to attend the following mandatory sessions:

  • Volunteer Orientation: Jan 28 OR Feb 4, 1:30-2:30pm, West Forum

  • Mid-semester Feedback Session: March 25

If you are interested in volunteering, please register here.

announcements.title: New NYUAD Business Meal Reimbursement Policy
announcements.message:
The new NYUAD business meal policy effective Jan 3rd 2018 aims to provide guidance on expenses related to Business Meals. 

KEY POLICY PROVISIONS:

  • The maximum amount that can be claimed for a single Business Meal is capped at AED 300 or USD 80 per person. Any amounts spent on a Business Meal in excess of this cap will not be reimbursable. 
  • The Business Meal limit of AED 300 or USD 80 is not inclusive of tips, taxes or service charges. A reimbursable tip can be given at the discretion of the authorized employee making payment on behalf of NYUAD and should not exceed 20% of the total bill.
  • All participants/attendees at the Business Meal must be listed in the claim for reimbursement
  • A brief description of the Business Purpose of the Business Meal is required.
  • Reimbursements for meals should be claimed within 60 days of the expense being incurred for employees’ subject to US tax withholdings

Please read the new Business Meal Reimbursement Policy. For enquiries, please contact me.

announcements.title: 6th UAE Undergraduate Research Competition
announcements.message:
Abu Dhabi University is pleased to announce it will be organizing the Sixth Undergraduate Research Competition. The competition will be held at Abu Dhabi University, on April 30th, 2018. This competition aims at encouraging universities in the UAE to promote scientific research among undergraduate students and to make it an integral part of university education, given the significance of scientific research in advancing the country to the top ranks. It also aims to instill life-long learning, and to enhance career opportunities for young people as well as foster entrepreneurial mindsets and attitudes in education, research, and innovation. Further information can be found on the ADU web page. 

Students wishing to take part in competitions should read the guidelines for undergraduate competitions and inform the Undergraduate Research Team.

announcements.title: English speakers needed for a research study.
announcements.message:
NYUAD faculty are conducting a study designed to investigate brain responses images and words and need your help!

If you are over 18 years old, a native English speaker, are right-handed and have normal or corrected to normal vision without glasses (lenses are fine), you are eligible to participate in this study.

The study will take place at the Neuroscience of Language Lab, A2-008 on the Saadiyat campus, and will require one to two hours of your time. You should be available during the week, for a 2-hour block of time between 9am – 7pm.

Participants will receive a transportation and meal allowance of 30 AED per half hour.

To express interest in participating, or for more information, please contact our research staff at meglab-nyuad-group@nyu.edu.

announcements.title: VAT and Dining Dirhams
announcements.message:
The UAE will implement value-added tax (VAT) at the rate of 5 percent from January 1, 2018, in accordance with Federal Decree Law No. 08 of 2017 and its Executive Regulations.  VAT is a 5 percent tax on the consumption or use of goods and services that the end user is required to pay and NYU Abu Dhabi will only be acting as a collection agent on behalf of the government.

Accordingly, from January 1, 2018, products and services offered by all our local vendors including ADNH will be VAT-inclusive which means the listed or quoted prices will include VAT.

Students will be granted an additional five percent (5%) to the student dining dirham portion of the meal plan.  Please note the supplemental 5% will not apply to meal swipes or stipends.

For questions regarding your dining dirhams, please contact  NYUAD.StudentFinance@nyu.edu who will direct your queries within the finance team.

Sign up here

announcements.title: VOLUNTEER | Program Registrations Live!
announcements.message:
Interested in volunteering and giving back to your community? Community Outreach has launched registration for all Fall volunteer programs today.
 

Special Needs Inclusion - Volunteer with individuals with intellectual disabilities:

> Future Rehabilitation Center classrooms
> Special Needs Adaptive Program (SNAP) Basketball

Youth Mentorship - Volunteer to facilitate leadership development in middle & high school youth:

> Girls’ Education Network (GEN)

announcements.title: VOLUNTEER | Join the Girls’ Education Network GEN
announcements.message:
The Girls’ Education Network (GEN) is a leadership development program that invites middle & high school girls in Abu Dhabi to cultivate a deeper understanding of themselves in order to mindfully engage with the world. Through a series of 6 workshops, GEN aims to create inclusive & supportive spaces by exploring themes such as self-awareness, mindfulness, empathetic listening, and design thinking. GEN is looking for female facilitators who are enthusiastic about girls’ education!

Time: 4-6 pm

Workshop Dates:

Sept 30

Oct 7, 14, 21

Nov 4, 11

Location: On campus

In order to become a GEN facilitator, it is mandatory to attend one of the following information sessions:

  • Sept 10: Living Room, 5:30-6:30 pm OR
  • Sept 17: Living Room, 5:30-6:30 pm

Facilitators are also required to attend the following trainings:

  • Volunteer Orientation on Sept 10 or 17: 1:30-2:45 pm
  • Facilitator Training on Sept 23: A6, 1-4 pm

To apply, please sign up here

Questions? Contact nyuad.gen@nyu.edu

announcements.title: VOLUNTEER | Join the Boys’ Education Network BEN
announcements.message:
The Boys’ Education Network (BEN) is a leadership development program for middle & high school boys in Abu Dhabi. Through its weekly workshops, BEN aims to cultivate a deeper understanding of themselves and the communities around them. The workshops cover practices such as self-awareness, team-building, conflict resolution and design thinking.

BEN is looking for male volunteers to serve as workshop facilitators. Volunteers will undergo training in preparation and will be responsible for conveying curriculum directly with the young participants. Workshops will be held weekly on campus on Saturdays during Fall from 4-6 pm.

Interested in impacting young lives? Register here and join us for our info session happening on Wed 13 Sept, 7-8 pm.

Facilitators are required to attend the following trainings:

  • Volunteer Orientation on September 10 or 17: 1:30-2:45 pm
  • Facilitator Training on September 23: A6, 1-4 pm

Questions? Please email nyuad.ben@nyu.edu

announcements.message:

Volunteer orientation: Sunday, Sept 10 OR Sept 17 from 1:30-2:45pm

Mid-semester Feedback Session: Nov 12 from 1:30-2:30

If interested, please register here

For any questions contact rp2550@nyu.edu

announcements.message:
Interested in working with special needs children & young adults? The Future Rehabilitation Centre welcomes you to work with their teachers, staff & students.

NYUAD volunteers will support students with special needs aged 3-23 in art, music, athletics, reading activities among others. The Centre wants volunteers to be "ready for action" & prepared to help FC students "learn through fun."

Classes run from 9-1pm, Sunday through Thursday. Volunteers must make a minimum commitment of at least one hour, once a week.

Volunteers are required to attend the following mandatory sessions:

Learners with Special Needs Training: Sept 30, 2-4pm

Volunteering term: Begins week of Sept 24 & finishes week of Dec 2

Mid-semester Feedback Session: Nov 5, 1:30-2:30

If you are interested in volunteering, please register here.

For questions or feedback, please contact Tala Hammash or visit W212, 2nd floor of the Campus Centre.

announcements.title: EC and African Studies | "Timbuktu " (film)
announcements.message:
Join us this Thursday, 04 May 2017, at 5.00p in A6 004 for Timbuktu (2014) Abderrahmane Sissako’s insightful drama about a family and a city shattered by bigotry and violence teeters between hope and despair, introduced by Erin Pettigrew, History and Arab Crossroads Studies.

A cattle herder and his family who reside in the dunes of Timbuktu find their quiet lives — which are typically free of the Jihadists determined to control their faith — abruptly disturbed.

This screening is part of the African Studies Series.

Watch the trailer for the film, and join us for our ongoing discussion of this year’s theme of Speculations.

For more information on Essential Cinema, follow our Facebook group, visit our website and join our mailing list (info on the website).

Everyone is always welcome, so please share with friends, colleagues, and family.

announcements.title: EC and Anchorage | "Happy Together" (film)
announcements.message:
Join us this Thursday, 27 April 2017, at 5.30p in C3 B1-101 for the third film in the “Full Spectrum” program, Happy Together (1997), on South African music before the end of Apartheid, introduced by Seung-hoon Jeong, Film and New Media.

Hong Kong cinema superstars Tony Leung and Leslie Cheung play a pair of lovers living out the waning days of their relationship as expatriates in Buenos Aires.

The film is the first of “Full Spectrum,” programmed by Wendy Bednarz, which examines the full spectrum of possibilities for love and relationships. These screenings are cross-listed with Anchorage Society’s Reel Queer Film Series.

Watch the trailer for the film, and join us for our ongoing discussion of this year’s theme of Speculations.

announcements.title: EC and African Studies | “Cemetery State" (film)
announcements.message:
(2010), a documentary about the people who inhabit the shantytown of Camp Luka (aka “State”) near the oldest and largest cemeteries in Kinshasa, with filmmaker/anthropologist Filip De Boeck, Leuven University.

This film follows one group of grave-diggers in the cemetery of Kintambo, where mourning rituals and funerals have become moments of upheaval and contest of social and political orders.

announcements.title: EC and African Studies | "Bamako Sigi-Kan" (film)
announcements.message:
Join us this Wednesday, 12 April 2017, at 5.00p in C3 B1-101 for Bamako Sigi-Kan (2002), a documentary of different points of view about neoliberalism’s effects on Bamako, Mali, introduced by Awam Ampka, Theater and Africana Studies, NYUNY.

This original documentary shot by Arthur Jafa brings a new look to the modern African city and enables a better understanding from the inside of how democracy takes root in Mali. Discover how politics in the city and in everyday life is lived in a changing society still inscribed within tradition as the men and women of Bamako tell their own stories.

This screening is part of the African Studies Series.
